title: China Regulator Probes Hundsun Technologies After Stocks Tumble
text:
China’s securities regulator is investigating Hundsun Technologies Inc. after the company denied suggestions that its trading systems may have helped fuel the recent tumble in China’s stock markets.
The regulator has sent an enforcement team to Hangzhou-based Hundsun to check that it is following market rules, China Securities Regulatory Commission spokesman Deng Ge said late Monday.
Hundsun, part-owned by Jack Ma’s Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., runs a financial investment platform known as HOMS, which allows trust firms and online lenders to provide trading facilities to their clients.
On Monday, Hundsun denied market rumors that the HOMS system had closed off margin trading positions during the recent market tumble and thereby added to the selling pressure.
Hundsun’s board secretary Tong Chenhui wasn’t immediately available for comment on the CSRC statement.
Hundsun shares rose 6 percent as of 9:59 a.m. in Shanghai, while the benchmark Shanghai Composite Index fell 0.6 percent.
